usdSysClockMIB.name: usdSysClockMIB

revisions.description: Initial version of this MIB module.

usdSysClockMIB.contactinfo: Unisphere Networks, Inc. Postal: 10 Technology Park Drive Westford, MA 01886 USA Tel: +1 978 589 5800 Email: mib@UnisphereNetworks.com
usdSysClockMIB.description: The System Clock and Network Time Protocol (NTP) MIB for the Unisphere Networks enterprise. The System Clock section of the MIB allows setting the system clock time, date and timezone. All definitions are based on the Gregorian calendar. The NTP portion of the MIB provides management for the local NTP client/server, which adheres to RFC 1305, the 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3) Specification, Implementation and Analysis'.

UsdSysClockHour.name: UsdSysClockHour
UsdSysClockHour.description: The hour of the day. Uses 24-hour clock format.

UsdNtpTimeStamp.name: UsdNtpTimeStamp
UsdNtpTimeStamp.description: The ASCII character representation of time in 64-bit unsigned long format, where the integer part is the first 32 bits and the fraction part is the last 32 bits. This represents the time stamp as defined in the NTP packet header format, which is the number of seconds since 1 January 1900. The textual form of an unsigned decimal number is taken from the NVT ASCII graphics character set (codes 46 and 48 through 57).
UsdNtpTimeStamp.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992. J. Postel & J. Reynolds, 'NVT ASCII character set', RFC-854, May 1983.

UsdNtpClockSignedTime.name: UsdNtpClockSignedTime
UsdNtpClockSignedTime.description: The ASCII character representation of NTP clock error time in seconds as a signed value. The first 16 bits represents integer part of the signed value and the last 16 bits represents the fraction part of the signed value. The textual form of a signed decimal number is taken from the NVT ASCII graphics character set (codes 43, 45, 46 and 48 through 57).
UsdNtpClockSignedTime.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992. J. Postel & J. Reynolds, 'NVT ASCII character set', RFC-854, May 1983.

UsdNtpClockUnsignedTime.name: UsdNtpClockUnsignedTime
UsdNtpClockUnsignedTime.description: The ASCII character representation of NTP clock error time in seconds as an unsigned value. The first 8 bits represents the integer part of the unsigned value and the last 48 bits represents the fraction part of the unsigned value. The textual form of an unsigned decimal number is taken from the NVT ASCII graphics character set (codes 46 and 48 through 57).
UsdNtpClockUnsignedTime.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992. J. Postel & J. Reynolds, 'NVT ASCII character set', RFC-854, May 1983

usdSysClockDateAndTime.name: usdSysClockDateAndTime
usdSysClockDateAndTime.description: This object is used to manage the system clock time, date and timezone. If the Network Time Protocol (NTP) is enabled, attempts to set this object will result in an inconsistantValue error. For sets, the implementation may check the value of the year and if it is outside of a 'reasonable' range (e.g., 1999..2035) it may return an inconsistantValue error. Only system clock time and date will be set if the timezone offset is not set along with the timezone name.

usdSysClockTimeZoneName.name: usdSysClockTimeZoneName
usdSysClockTimeZoneName.description: Name of the timezone. Timezone name take effects only with its offset set along with it.

usdSysClockDstName.name: usdSysClockDstName
usdSysClockDstName.description: The name of the daylight savings time (DST) zone. Setting any standard US DST timezone name with recurrent mode will result in turning on corresponding DST recurrent mode values for the timezone.

usdSysClockDstOffset.name: usdSysClockDstOffset
usdSysClockDstOffset.description: The offset, in minutes, from the base timezone for the DST.

usdSysClockDstStatus.name: usdSysClockDstStatus
usdSysClockDstStatus.description: The state of DST. With each state, only corresponding objects can be set. When the state is off(0), set values will be ignored.

usdSysClockDstAbsoluteStartTime.name: usdSysClockDstAbsoluteStartTime
usdSysClockDstAbsoluteStartTime.description: This object represents the start time for absolute DST. Only the year, month, day, hour and minutes fields of the object are used. The other fields will be ignored for a Set operation and will return zeroes for a Get operation.

usdSysClockDstAbsoluteStopTime.name: usdSysClockDstAbsoluteStopTime
usdSysClockDstAbsoluteStopTime.description: This object represents the stop time for absolute DST. Only the year, month, day, hour and minutes fields of the object are used. The other fields will be ignored for a Set operation and will return zeroes when read.

usdSysClockDstRecurStartMonth.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStartMonth
usdSysClockDstRecurStartMonth.description: The start month for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStartWeek.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStartWeek
usdSysClockDstRecurStartWeek.description: The start week of the month for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStartDay.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStartDay
usdSysClockDstRecurStartDay.description: The start day of the week for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStartHour.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStartHour
usdSysClockDstRecurStartHour.description: The start hour for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStartMinute.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStartMinute
usdSysClockDstRecurStartMinute.description: The start minute for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStopMonth.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStopMonth
usdSysClockDstRecurStopMonth.description: The stop month for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStopWeek.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStopWeek
usdSysClockDstRecurStopWeek.description: The stop week of the month for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStopDay.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStopDay
usdSysClockDstRecurStopDay.description: The stop day of the week for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStopHour.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStopHour
usdSysClockDstRecurStopHour.description: The stop hour for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdSysClockDstRecurStopMinute.name: usdSysClockDstRecurStopMinute
usdSysClockDstRecurStopMinute.description: The stop minutes for DST recurrence. The default value is based on the 1987 law for the USA.

usdNtpSysClockState.name: usdNtpSysClockState
usdNtpSysClockState.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpSysClockState.description: Displays the state of the NTP on the system clock. Clock states are: 0 - Clock has never been calibrated for frequency errors 1 - Clock frequency errors calibration has done 2 - Clock time has set to server time 3 - Clock frequency errors calibration is going on 4 - Clock has synchronized its time 5 - Clock has detected spike

usdNtpSysClockOffsetError.name: usdNtpSysClockOffsetError
usdNtpSysClockOffsetError.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpSysClockOffsetError.description: Displays the estimated offset error of the system clock relative to the master clock in seconds. This variable can take on both positive and negative values; the value will be positive if the system clock is ahead of the master clock; the value will be negative if the system clock is behind the master clock. This offset value will be used by internal the NTP filter algorithm to adjust the system clock to correct its error.

usdNtpSysClockFrequencyError.name: usdNtpSysClockFrequencyError
usdNtpSysClockFrequencyError.description: Displays the system clock frequency error in parts per million (ppm). It will always be a positive value. This error adjustment happens when the system reboots or the NTP is enabled for the first time and it may take up to fifteen minutes to complete. Each system clock oscillator interrupts to update its clock. If for example, it interrupts one million time per second then it has resolution of microseconds. This is also frequency of the clock update. Frequency error represents failed to update by parts per millionth of a second. For example, if we have frequency error of 1ppm, it means clock is ahead by 0.864 second in a day and that much has to be corrected in a day for clock to be accurate. Frequency error varies with temperature. Due to this system clock has to be corrected when system boots based on temperature it has to operate.

usdNtpSysClockRootDelay.name: usdNtpSysClockRootDelay
usdNtpSysClockRootDelay.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpSysClockRootDelay.description: This indicates the NTP time message total Network roundtrip delay to the primary reference source at the root of the synchronization subnet, in seconds. Note that this variable can take on both positive and negative values, depending on clock precision and skew.

usdNtpSysClockRootDispersion.name: usdNtpSysClockRootDispersion
usdNtpSysClockRootDispersion.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpSysClockRootDispersion.description: This indicates the maximum error relative to the primary reference source at the root of the synchronization subnet, in seconds. Only positive values greater than zero are possible.

usdNtpSysClockStratumNumber.name: usdNtpSysClockStratumNumber
usdNtpSysClockStratumNumber.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpSysClockStratumNumber.description: Displays the stratum number of the system clock. 1 - primary reference (e.g. calibrated atomic clock, radio clock) 2-255 - secondary reference (via NTP)

usdNtpSysClockLastUpdateTime.name: usdNtpSysClockLastUpdateTime
usdNtpSysClockLastUpdateTime.description: Displays the time of the system clock at the time when it was last updated by any associated NTP server(peer).

usdNtpSysClockLastUpdateServer.name: usdNtpSysClockLastUpdateServer
usdNtpSysClockLastUpdateServer.description: Displays the IP address of the NTP server (peer) which done last update to the system clock.

usdNtpClientAdminStatus.name: usdNtpClientAdminStatus
usdNtpClientAdminStatus.description: By enabling/disabling the NTP admin status, the router is enabled/ disabled to run as NTP client for the correction and synchronization of the system clock time with the reliable time sources (stratum time servers). At any given time, only one NTP client can run on any router on the system. Sets the NTP admin status along with the routerIndex where NTP client has be enabled in that router context.

usdNtpClientSystemRouterIndex.name: usdNtpClientSystemRouterIndex
usdNtpClientSystemRouterIndex.description: The index of the router to be enabled or disabled as the system-wide NTP client. Always set along with usdNtpClientAdminStatus. This is also the router context when NTP is enabled.

usdNtpClientPacketSourceIfIndex.name: usdNtpClientPacketSourceIfIndex
usdNtpClientPacketSourceIfIndex.description: When the NTP client sends an NTP packet, the source IP address is normally set to the address of the interface through which the NTP packet is sent. Sets all the outgoing NTP packets' source ifIndex to one specific ifIndex on the NTP client from which the source ifIndex is taken. This ifIndex will be the index of the IP interface as NTP is IP/UDP based. If the value is zero, it means no interface has configured.

usdNtpClientBroadcastDelay.name: usdNtpClientBroadcastDelay
usdNtpClientBroadcastDelay.description: Allows to set the estimated round-trip broadcast delay between the system client and broadcast servers (peers).

usdNtpClientIfTable.name: usdNtpClientIfTable
usdNtpClientIfTable.description: Lists all the NTP client's interfaces enabled for NTP. All the IP interfaces on the NTP client are by default enabled for NTP communications and can be disabled individually on each IP interface. If desired, any IP interface can be blocked from participating in NTP communication.

usdNtpClientIfEntry.name: usdNtpClientIfEntry
usdNtpClientIfEntry.description: Each entry is per interface config for NTP.

usdNtpClientIfRouterIndex.name: usdNtpClientIfRouterIndex
usdNtpClientIfRouterIndex.description: The index of the router to be enabled or disabled as an NTP client.

usdNtpClientIfIfIndex.name: usdNtpClientIfIfIndex
usdNtpClientIfIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the interface on the NTP client.

usdNtpClientIfIsBroadcastClient.name: usdNtpClientIfIsBroadcastClient
usdNtpClientIfIsBroadcastClient.description: Enable/disable NTP client's interface as broadcast client. As NTP client's broadcast interface, it receives the broadcast NTP messages from the associated servers (peers).

usdNtpServerStratumNumber.name: usdNtpServerStratumNumber
usdNtpServerStratumNumber.description: Configure the stratum number (level) of the NTP server. Due to one system clock, setting the stratum number have a effect of setting all the NTP servers' stratum to one stratum number(level) on the system.

usdNtpServerAdminStatus.name: usdNtpServerAdminStatus
usdNtpServerAdminStatus.description: Enable/disable the NTP server on the router.

usdNtpPeerCfgTable.name: usdNtpPeerCfgTable
usdNtpPeerCfgTable.description: This table provides information on the peers with which the NTP client has associations. The associated peers(servers) to client will be running different hosts.

usdNtpPeerCfgEntry.name: usdNtpPeerCfgEntry
usdNtpPeerCfgEntry.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpPeerCfgEntry.description: Each entry provides one NTP server's configuration information. Each peer is uniquely identified by the routerIndex of the client to which it has to be associated and the Ip address of the remote server(peer) itself. Entries are automatically created when the user configures the remote peer NTP server info on the system which has to be associated with the NTP client and deleted when the user removes the peer association from the NTP server.

usdNtpPeerCfgNtpVersion.name: usdNtpPeerCfgNtpVersion
usdNtpPeerCfgNtpVersion.description: Displays the peer server NTP software version.

usdNtpPeerCfgPacketSourceIfIndex.name: usdNtpPeerCfgPacketSourceIfIndex
usdNtpPeerCfgPacketSourceIfIndex.description: All the outgoing NTP packets' source address can be configured to one specific interface address on the NTP peer server. This object allows to configure all the outgoing NTP packets' source IP ifIndex to one specific IP ifIndex on the NTP server.

usdNtpPeerCfgIsPreferred.name: usdNtpPeerCfgIsPreferred
usdNtpPeerCfgIsPreferred.description: Select whether this NTP server is a preferred time source to the NTP client to which it has association.

usdNtpPeerCfgRowStatus.name: usdNtpPeerCfgRowStatus
usdNtpPeerCfgRowStatus.description: Controls creation/deletion of entries in this table according to the RowStatus textual convention, constrained to support the following values only: createAndGo destroy To create an entry in this table, the following entry objects MUST be explicitly configured: usdNtpPeerCfgRowStatus

usdNtpPeerTable.name: usdNtpPeerTable
usdNtpPeerTable.description: This table provides information on the peers with which the NTP client has associations. The associated peers (servers) to client will be running different hosts.

usdNtpPeerEntry.name: usdNtpPeerEntry
usdNtpPeerEntry.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpPeerEntry.description: Each entry provides one NTP server (peer) information. Each peer is uniquely identified by the routerIndex of the client to which it has to be associated and the Ip address of the remote server (peer) itself. Entries are automatically created when the user configures the remote peer NTP server info on the system which has to be associated with the NTP client and deleted when the user removes the peer association from the NTP server.

usdNtpPeerState.name: usdNtpPeerState
usdNtpPeerState.description: Displays the peer server association state to NTP client on the system. Bit Peer State Description --- ---------- ------------------------------------------------ 0 master Means NTP client on the system has chosen this peer server as the master. 1 configured Confirms peer server configured for the NTP client. 2 selected NTP client will consider this peer server when it chooses the master. 3 unusable Indication that the server does not meet the initial criteria for the master 4 preferred Indicates as preferred time source. 5 correct NTP client considers the peer server's clock is reasonably correct. 6 incorrect NTP client considers the peer server's clock is not reasonably correct 7 reserved Each bit position value of 0 and 1 disables and enables that peer state respectively.

usdNtpPeerStratumNumber.name: usdNtpPeerStratumNumber
usdNtpPeerStratumNumber.description: Displays the peer server system clock stratum number.

usdNtpPeerAssociationMode.name: usdNtpPeerAssociationMode
usdNtpPeerAssociationMode.description: Displays the peer server association mode to the NTP client on the router. broadcastServer - Broadcast only NTP messages. multicastServer - Broadcast only NTP messages for IGMP multicast Network. unicastServer - Only sends NTP poll messages to the peer servers.

usdNtpPeerBroadcastInterval.name: usdNtpPeerBroadcastInterval
usdNtpPeerBroadcastInterval.description: Displays the broadcast time interval of the NTP time messages from the peer when the peer is enabled either as broadcast server or multicast server.

usdNtpPeerPolledInterval.name: usdNtpPeerPolledInterval
usdNtpPeerPolledInterval.description: Displays the time interval at which peer will be polled by NTP client with which peer has associations when it is enabled as unicast server.

usdNtpPeerPollingInterval.name: usdNtpPeerPollingInterval
usdNtpPeerPollingInterval.description: Displays the time interval at which peer will poll the servers with which peer has associations when it is enabled as unicast server.

usdNtpPeerDelay.name: usdNtpPeerDelay
usdNtpPeerDelay.description: Displays the peer server broadcast delay.

usdNtpPeerOffsetError.name: usdNtpPeerOffsetError
usdNtpPeerOffsetError.description: Displays the peer server offset error.

usdNtpPeerReachability.name: usdNtpPeerReachability
usdNtpPeerReachability.description: Displays the peer reachability status. An 8-bit number that shows whether or not the peer server responded to the last eight requests to the server to which it has association; one indicates a response, zero indicates no response. Count from rightmost to leftmost as latest to later requests as reachability states. For example, 0b11111111 indicates that the peer server responded to the last eight requests. If the system client reaches one peer server less often than it does other peer servers, that server is not a good choice for the master

usdNtpPeerRootDelay.name: usdNtpPeerRootDelay
usdNtpPeerRootDelay.description: Displays the peer server root delay.

usdNtpPeerRootDispersion.name: usdNtpPeerRootDispersion
usdNtpPeerRootDispersion.description: Displays the peer server root dispersion.

usdNtpPeerRootSyncDistance.name: usdNtpPeerRootSyncDistance
usdNtpPeerRootSyncDistance.description: Displays the peer server synchronization distance. Measure of the total time error since the update in the path to the stratum 1 server.

usdNtpPeerRootTime.name: usdNtpPeerRootTime
usdNtpPeerRootTime.description: Last time at which the stratum 1 server sent clock update reply to the this peer server.

usdNtpPeerRootTimeUpdateServer.name: usdNtpPeerRootTimeUpdateServer
usdNtpPeerRootTimeUpdateServer.description: IP address of the stratum 1 server last updated the peer server.

usdNtpPeerReceiveTime.name: usdNtpPeerReceiveTime
usdNtpPeerReceiveTime.description: If the peer server is either broadcast or multicast server, this will represent time stamp at which NTP client received the broadcast message. If it is unicast server, it represents the time stamp at which the peer has sent the response to the NTP client poll message.

usdNtpPeerTransmitTime.name: usdNtpPeerTransmitTime
usdNtpPeerTransmitTime.description: If the peer server is either broadcast or multicast server, this will represent time stamp at which peer sent the broadcast message. If it is unicast server, it represents the time stamp at which the NTP client has received response from the peer.

usdNtpPeerRequestTime.name: usdNtpPeerRequestTime
usdNtpPeerRequestTime.description: For unicast server, it represents the time stamp at which the system client sent NTP request to the peer.

usdNtpPeerPrecision.name: usdNtpPeerPrecision
usdNtpPeerPrecision.description: Length of the clock tick (interrupt interval) of the server's clock.

usdNtpPeerFilterRegisterTable.name: usdNtpPeerFilterRegisterTable
usdNtpPeerFilterRegisterTable.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpPeerFilterRegisterTable.description: The following table contains NTP state variables used by the NTP clock filter and selection algorithms. This table depicts a shift register. Each stage in the shift register is a 3-tuple consisting of the measured clock offset, measured clock delay and measured clock dispersion associated with a single observation. The NTP clock-filter and selection algorithms are designed to minimize the error in the calculated time by using the objects values in the filter table.

usdNtpPeerFilterRegisterEntry.name: usdNtpPeerFilterRegisterEntry
usdNtpPeerFilterRegisterEntry.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpPeerFilterRegisterEntry.description: Each entry corresponds to one stage of the shift register and reading one set of values clock delay, clock offset and clock dispersion. Entries are automatically created whenever a peer is configured and deleted when the peer is removed.

usdNtpPeerFilterIndex.name: usdNtpPeerFilterIndex
usdNtpPeerFilterIndex.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpPeerFilterIndex.description: An integer value in the specified range that is used to index into the table. The size of the table is fixed at 8. Each entry identifies a particular reading of the clock filter variables in the shift register. Entries are added starting at index 1. The index wraps back to 1 when it reaches 8. When the index wraps back, the new entries will overwrite the old entries effectively deleting the old entry.

usdNtpPeerFilterOffset.name: usdNtpPeerFilterOffset
usdNtpPeerFilterOffset.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpPeerFilterOffset.description: The offset of the peer clock relative to the system clock in seconds.

usdNtpPeerFilterDelay.name: usdNtpPeerFilterDelay
usdNtpPeerFilterDelay.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpPeerFilterDelay.description: Roundtrip delay of the peer clock relative to the system clock over the network path between them, in seconds. This variable can take on both positive and negative values, depending on clock precision and skew-error accumulation.

usdNtpPeerFilterDispersion.name: usdNtpPeerFilterDispersion
usdNtpPeerFilterDispersion.reference: D.L. Mills, 'Network Time Protocol (Version 3)', RFC-1305, March 1992
usdNtpPeerFilterDispersion.description: The maximum error of the peer clock relative to the system clock over the network path between them, in seconds. Only positive values greater than zero are possible.

usdNtpRouterAccessGroupPeer.name: usdNtpRouterAccessGroupPeer
usdNtpRouterAccessGroupPeer.description: Configure the name of the peer access list for the NTP enabled router.

usdNtpRouterAccessGroupServe.name: usdNtpRouterAccessGroupServe
usdNtpRouterAccessGroupServe.description: Configure the name of the serve access list for the NTP enabled router.

usdNtpRouterAccessGroupServeOnly.name: usdNtpRouterAccessGroupServeOnly
usdNtpRouterAccessGroupServeOnly.description: Configure the name of the serve-only access list for the NTP enabled router.

usdNtpRouterAccessGroupQueryOnly.name: usdNtpRouterAccessGroupQueryOnly
usdNtpRouterAccessGroupQueryOnly.description: Configure the name of the peer query-only list for the NTP enabled router.

usdSysClockCompliance.name: usdSysClockCompliance
usdSysClockCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities that implement the Unisphere System Clock MIB.

usdSysClockTimeGroup.name: usdSysClockTimeGroup
usdSysClockTimeGroup.description: The management objects pertaining to the System Clock current date and time.

usdSysClockDstGroup.name: usdSysClockDstGroup
usdSysClockDstGroup.description: The management objects pertaining to the System Clock daylight savings time information.

usdNtpSysClockGroup.name: usdNtpSysClockGroup
usdNtpSysClockGroup.description: The management objects pertaining to the system clock when NTP is configured on the system.

usdNtpClientGroup.name: usdNtpClientGroup
usdNtpClientGroup.description: The management objects pertaining to the NTP client group.

usdNtpServerGroup.name: usdNtpServerGroup
usdNtpServerGroup.description: The management objects pertaining to the NTP server group.

usdNtpPeersGroup.name: usdNtpPeersGroup
usdNtpPeersGroup.description: The management objects pertaining to the NTP peers group.

usdNtpAccessGroupGroup.name: usdNtpAccessGroupGroup
usdNtpAccessGroupGroup.description: The management objects pertaining to the NTP per router access group.
